name: Crawl Websites & Answer Questions with GPT-5 nano and Google Sheets

user.name: Oriol Segu√≠
user.bio: Completion of a higher degree on the way to university (computer engineering)

description:
## **Web Consultation & Crawling Chatbot with Google Sheets Memory**

**Who is this workflow for?**
This workflow is designed for **SEO analysts, content creators, marketing agencies, and developers** who need to index a website and then interact with its content as if it were a chatbot.
‚ö† **Note:** if the site contains many pages, AI token consumption can generate **high costs**, especially during the initial crawling and analysis phase.

---

### **1. Initial Mode (first use with a URL)**

When the user enters a URL for the first time:

1. **URL validation** using AI (gpt-5-nano).
2. **Automatic sitemap discovery** via `robots.txt`.
3. **Relevant sitemap selection** (pages, posts, categories, or tags) using GPT-4o according to configured options.
   *(Includes ‚ÄúOPTIONS‚Äù node to precisely choose which types of URLs to process)*
4. **Crawling of all selected pages**:

   * Downloads HTML of each page.
   * Converts HTML to Markdown.
   * AI analysis to extract:

     * Detected language.
     * Heading hierarchy (H1, H2, etc.).
     * Internal and external links.
     * Content summary.
5. **Structured storage** in Google Sheets:

   * Lang
   * H1 and hierarchy
   * External URLs
   * Internal URLs
   * Summary Content
   * Data schema (flag to enable agent mode)

When finished, the sheet is marked with **`Data schema = true`**, signaling that the site is indexed.

---

### **2. Agent Mode (subsequent queries)**

If the URL has already been indexed (`Data schema = true`):

1. The chat becomes a **LangChain Agent** that:

   * Reads the database in Google Sheets.
   * Can perform **real-time HTTP requests** if it needs updated information.
   * Responds **as if it were the website**, using stored and live data.

This allows the user to ask questions such as:

* *"What‚Äôs on the contact page?"*
* *"How many external links are there on the homepage?"*
* *"Give me all the H1 headings from the services pages"*
* *"What CTA would you suggest for my page?"*
* *"How would you expand X content?"*

---

### **Use cases**

* Build a chatbot that answers questions about a website‚Äôs content.
* Index and analyze full websites for future queries.
* SEO tool to list headings, links, and content summaries.
* Assistant for quick exploration of a site‚Äôs structure.
* Generate improvement recommendations and content strategies from site data.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

nodes.name: Append row in sheet in Google Sheets

parameters.content:
## Overview
This is a web consultation chat workflow that, on the first run with a given URL, discovers the sitemap, crawls the site, extracts useful information (language, H1 hierarchy, internal/external links, summary) and stores it in Google Sheets.

From then on, if the ‚Äúschema‚Äù flag is set in the sheet (Data schema = true), the chat switches to an Agent mode that responds to the user ‚Äúas if it were the website,‚Äù consulting the database (Google Sheets) and making controlled HTTP requests when needed.

## 1) Chat trigger & schema check

* **Chat web (trigger)** ‚Äì Public webhook with Basic Auth. Captures `chatInput`.
* **Get data schema (Google Sheets)** ‚Äì Filters rows where **Data schema = true**.
* **If**:

  * If schema exists ‚Üí **Branch A (Agent mode with existing data)**.
  * If not ‚Üí **Branch B (URL validation & initial crawling)**.

---

## 2) Branch A ‚Äî Agent mode (consults an already indexed site)

* **AI Agent** (LangChain Agent):

  * *System*: ‚ÄúYou act as a website‚Ä¶ use the tool sheet to access all site info.‚Äù
  * **Connected tools**:

    * **Get row(s) in sheet in Google Sheets** ‚Äì lets the agent read the database.
    * **HTTP Request2** ‚Äì allows the agent to fetch a URL it generates via `$fromAI('URL')`.
  * **OpenAI Chat Model (gpt-5-nano)** ‚Äì LLM powering the agent.
  * **Simple Memory** ‚Äì short-term context window (50 messages).
* **Respond to Chat1** ‚Äì Sends the agent‚Äôs `output` back to the user.

**Purpose**: The user can ask questions (‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs on page X?‚Äù, ‚ÄúWhat links are there?‚Äù), and the agent answers using the sheet‚Äôs stored data and, if necessary, live HTTP fetches.

---

## 3) Branch B ‚Äî URL validation & crawl preparation

* **AI Agent1** (URL classifier):

  * *System*: ‚ÄúReturn JSON with `URL` and `URL_bool` (true if it‚Äôs a valid URL).‚Äù
  * **OpenAI Chat Model1 (gpt-5-nano)** + **Structured Output Parser** enforce JSON.
* **If1**:

  * If `URL_bool = true` ‚Üí continue.
  * If `false` ‚Üí **Respond to Chat** (‚ÄúYou must enter a valid URL‚Ä¶‚Äù).
* **OPTIONS (Set)**: Flags to choose which sitemaps to process:

  * `scan_pages: true`, `scan_posts/category/tags: false` (pages only).
* **UA Rotativo1 (Code)**: Selects a **random User-Agent** (desktop/mobile, Win/Mac/iOS/Android) to reduce blocking.
* **Req robots (HTTP Request)**: Downloads `robots.txt` from `{{ AI Agent1.output.URL }}/robots.txt` with realistic headers (language, compression, referer, etc.). If it fails, goes to **Req Error** (‚ÄúURL not valid‚Ä¶‚Äù).
* **extract sitemap url (Code)**: Parses `robots.txt` and **extracts the `Sitemap:` line** ‚Üí `sitemapUrl`.
* **Maping Sitemap (HTTP Request)**: Downloads the **sitemap index** (`sitemapindex`) with error handling (failure ‚Üí **Sitemap Error**).
* **XML1 (XML‚ÜíJSON)**: Converts the sitemap XML to JSON.

## 4) Selecting the specific sitemap (pages)

* **Message a model (GPT-4o)**:

  * *System*: Ask the model to **select and return in JSON** the relevant sitemaps based on the flags (`scan_pages`, `scan_posts`, etc.).
  * *User*: Passes the first 3 `loc` entries from `sitemapindex`.
  * **Expected output**: e.g. `{ "sitemap_page": "https://‚Ä¶" }`.
* **Maping Sitemaps (HTTP Request)**: Downloads the **pages sitemap** provided by the model.
* **XML (XML‚ÜíJSON)**: Converts it to JSON (`urlset.url`).

---

## 5) Expanding URLs & page-by-page processing loop

* **Merge (Code)**: Turns `urlset.url` into an object `{ urls: { "url 1": "...", "url 2": "..." } }`.
* **Split URLs**: Breaks that object into **one item per URL**.
* **Loop Over Items (SplitInBatches)**: Iterates through each URL (supports batching). From here, two parallel flows run:

  1. **Req URL (HTTP Request)** ‚Üí **HTML to Markdown** ‚Üí **Message a model1 (gpt-5-nano)**:

     * *System*: ‚ÄúYou will receive page content; extract: summary, language, H1/hierarchy, internal links (no CSS/JS/images), external links; then add them to the DB via the sheet tool.‚Äù
     * *User*: `{{ $json.data }}` (HTML converted to Markdown).
     * **Append row in sheet in Google Sheets (Tool)** is connected as an **AI tool** and uses `$fromAI(...)` mappings to fill columns:

       * **Lang**, **H1 and hierarchy**, **External URLs**, **Internal URLs**, **Summary Content**.
     * **Result**: Adds one row per page with extracted fields.
  2. **Complete (Google Sheets, appendOrUpdate)**:

     * Marks/ensures a row with **`Data schema = true`** exists (acts as a ‚Äúready‚Äù flag so future runs go into **Agent mode**).

---

## 6) What gets stored in Google Sheets

Sheet: **‚ÄúWeb‚Äù** (gid=0). Columns in the schema:

* **Lang** ‚Äì detected language.
* **H1 and hierarchy** ‚Äì H1 and heading hierarchy.
* **External URLs** ‚Äì outbound links.
* **Internal URLs** ‚Äì valid internal links.
* **Summary Content** ‚Äì page summary.
* **Data schema** ‚Äì boolean flag controlling the flow mode.

> Note: In the current mapping of ‚ÄúAppend row‚Ä¶‚Äù, only these 5 are populated. ‚ÄúPage URL‚Äù and ‚ÄúContent text‚Äù exist in the schema but are not currently mapped (you could add them by requesting from the LLM and using `$fromAI`).



## 7) Models & memory

* **gpt-5-nano** ‚Äì for URL classification, per-page structured extraction, and main Agent responses when data exists.
* **GPT-4o** ‚Äì for sitemap selection from the index.
* **Memory** ‚Äì 50-message context window for short-term chat continuity in Agent mode.

## User experience per case

* **No valid URL** ‚Äì Returns a message requesting a sample URL.
* **First time with valid URL** ‚Äì No data yet; runs **discovery ‚Üí crawling ‚Üí extraction ‚Üí save to Sheets**.
* **Subsequent interactions** (with `Data schema = true`) ‚Äì **Agent** answers as if it were the website, using the **DB in Sheets** and live HTTP when needed.
